items.title: error while using WTForms-Components==0.10.4
items.body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19998416/79990520-c6b37300-84ce-11ea-9cce-f8004aa20de0.png)


I installed WTForms-Components==0.10.4 and it gives an error while running my flask application. 
I am also installing WTForms-Alchemy==0.16.9 and Flask-WTF==0.14.2.


check the logs in the picture.
the top line is code inside my file and the rest are all inside the package files

The error seems to occur inside one of the wtform core files. This is something i noticed just a few hours ago and did not occur before. Could it be some version incompatibility issue? 

I also found a pull request which removes the HTMLString from the code here https://github.com/wtforms/wtforms/pull/400

items.title: Adapt to WTForms version 2.3
items.body:
There are changes in the new [WTForms version 2.3](https://github.com/wtforms/wtforms/blob/master/CHANGES.rst#version-230) that break the code. The removing of `HTMLField` leads to import errors.
Thanks four you engagement!

items.title: PhoneNumberField field in docs but not on module
items.body:
`PhoneNumberField` is in the docs but is missing from this module. I dug through the commit log and found that the field (and maybe others) have move to ```WTForms-Alchemy```. Please update the docs. 

Cheers,
Evans

items.title: The "Unique" validator is no longer present?
items.body:
In the latest documentation [Unique Validator](https://wtforms-components.readthedocs.io/en/latest/#unique-validator) is presented as a way for checking the unicity of given field in database.
A quick check of the [source code](https://github.com/kvesteri/wtforms-components/blob/master/wtforms_components/validators.py) shows no sign of  the **Unique** class. 
I can't figure out how this works. Can someone give me an example?
Thank you!

items.title: cgi.escape is deprecated, use html.escape instead
items.body:
Hi,

We are getting this error:
```
/opt/app-root/lib/python3.4/site-packages/wtforms_components/widgets.py:278: DeprecationWarning: cgi.escape is deprecated, use html.escape instead
    data = (html_params(**options), escape(six.text_type(label))
```

Just replacing to to html.escape would do the work?

items.title: TimeField erases seconds
items.body: A time like 19:17:13 stored in the database gets displayed as 19:17 by TimeField, and saving the form erases the :13 from the database.

items.title: No PhoneNumberField in 0.10.0 release
items.body:
```
  File "/Users/bistenes/Code/webthing/src/application/forms.py", line 16, in <module>
    from wtforms_components import PhoneNumberField
ImportError: cannot import name PhoneNumberField
```

Works fine up until 0.9.9.

items.title: WTForms=2.1 removes wtforms.ext.sqlalchemy
items.body:
wtforms_components/fields/ajax.py imports from wtforms.ext.sqlalchemy and fails with the latest version of wtforms.

See Commit:
https://github.com/wtforms/wtforms/commit/c49ecfb7e76f919eafb5c6a11c3b795c4e613757

ImportError
c:\python27\lib\site-packages\wtforms_components\fields\ajax.py in <module>()
      4 import six
      5 from wtforms import fields, widgets
----> 6 from wtforms.ext.sqlalchemy.fields import get_pk_from_identity
      7 from wtforms.validators import ValidationError
      8

items.title: Unique validator, what is `form._obj`?
items.body:
https://github.com/kvesteri/wtforms-components/blob/80284f920dd7432a27e43695a370901c8305bd8f/wtforms_components/validators.py#L242
I'm using the `Unique` validator from `wtforms_components` directly. What is `from._obj`? I'ts not a attribute of my form which inherits from `flask_wtf.Form`. Replacing the line linked above by `if obj:` fixes the problem for me. It's also misleading to raise an `ValidationError` in case the `_obj` attribute is not set. You should rather raise a different Exception.

items.title: read_only function should also prevent field from populating the data
items.body:
I am trying to create a form with some fields that should not be writable by the user. By using `read_only` function the html side works as expected, but it seems that the field still populates the data when `form.populate_obj` is called. I can't see any case where we would like to have html side say that the field is read_only but still save the changes that the user has made to that field. Therefore I would expect that calling `read_only` to a field also disables populating of that field during `form.populate_obj` function call.

My current workaround is to manually remove all read_only fields from the form before calling `form.populate_obj`.

items.title: SQLAlchemy-Utils is broken
items.body: wtforms_components is pulling the latest version, but the latest version is broken.

items.title: 'UnboundField' object has no attribute 'widget'
items.body:
In minimum example:

from flask import Flask
from wtforms import Form, DateField, TextField
from wtforms_components import TimeField, read_only

class EventForm(Form):
    name = read_only(TextField('Name'))
    start_date = DateField('Start date')
    start_time = TimeField('Start time')

app = Flask(**name**)

@app.route('/')
def hello_world():
    form = EventForm()
    return 'Hello World!'

if **name** == '**main**':
    app.run()

Traceback:
/home/lov3catch/PycharmProjects/venv/Option/bin/python2.7 /home/lov3catch/PycharmProjects/wtf_test/wtf_test.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/lov3catch/PycharmProjects/wtf_test/wtf_test.py", line 5, in <module>
    class EventForm(Form):
  File "/home/lov3catch/PycharmProjects/wtf_test/wtf_test.py", line 6, in EventForm
    name = read_only(TextField('Name'))
  File "/home/lov3catch/PycharmProjects/venv/Option/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/wtforms_components/**init**.py", line 83, in read_only
    field.widget = ReadOnlyWidgetProxy(field.widget)
AttributeError: 'UnboundField' object has no attribute 'widget'

Pls, help

items.title: Unique validator not working with dict syntax
items.body: Neither 'InstrumentedAttribute' object nor 'Comparator' object associated with ExampleModel.example_property has an attribute 'name'

items.title: Imports fail in 0.8.1
items.body:
My tests started failing on 0.8.1, with the following traceback:

```
from wtforms_alchemy import model_form_factory
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python2.7/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/wtforms_alchemy/__init__.py", line 5, in <module>
    from wtforms_components import (
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python2.7/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/wtforms_components/__init__.py", line 2, in <module>
    from .fields import (
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python2.7/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/wtforms_components/fields/__init__.py", line 2, in <module>
    from .html5 import (
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python2.7/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/wtforms_components/fields/html5.py", line 3, in <module>
    from ..widgets import (
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python2.7/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/wtforms_components/widgets.py", line 11, in <module>
    from .validators import DateRange, TimeRange
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python2.7/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/wtforms_components/validators.py", line 5, in <module>
    from validators import is_email as email
ImportError: cannot import name is_email
```

Works fine with wtforms-components 0.8.0.

items.title: Lazy choices and default value for SelectField should render the associated option as selected
DecimalField doesn't allow decimals
items.body:
DecimalField is converted into type="number" but it is missing step argument. This means you can only type integers using Chrome. Adding step="any" or step="0.1" (depending on specified precision) would fix this.

Please see http://blog.isotoma.com/2012/03/html5-input-typenumber-and-decimalsfloats-in-chrome/ for more details.

items.title: Add HTML5 compatible TextField and TextAreaField
items.body: This should support required flag in same manner as other HTML5 fields.

items.title: DecimalField should render step
items.body: If step is missing, Chrome doesn't accept for example value "2.55". It accepts only "2.0" or "3.0" because default step is 1. In this case step should be "0.01".
